evidence.note: Three trigger mechanisms explored: naming pattern (TODO_), docstring detection (// TODO above), keyboard shortcut (Tab/Ctrl+Alt+S). Need to choose which prevents false positives while staying intuitive.

what: Map activation patterns for pseudocode stub generation
key_basis: User workflow discussion - first command to implement

evidence.note: Two modes: @rhizome stub (type-based inference), @rhizome stub infer (LLM-powered). Generates function with docstring, properties, NotImplementedError, TODO. Works TS/JS/Python. LLM config TBD.

what: Pseudocode stub generation via @rhizome stub command with properties inference
key_basis: User workflow clarification - imperative command, not marker. Property inference dual-mode.
key_gaps: LLM backend selection, type inference rules per language

evidence.note: Type-based: fast, always available. LLM-infer: richer properties on demand. Both generate function with docstring+properties+NotImplementedError+TODO. Works TS/JS/Python.

what: Stub command: two modes (type-infer default, LLM-infer on-demand)
key_basis: Architecture clarified through user dialogue
key_gaps: LLM backend, type inference rules per language, file structure TBD

evidence.note: Proposed structure links to: stub commands (Pseudocode Without Friction), inference layers (Test-Driven Top-Down), language adapters (multi-language support), config layer (LLM backend). Open questions: parsing strategy, code insertion UX, config location.

what: Extension file structure: src/, test/, config organized by concern
key_basis: Extension architecture best practices + project needs
key_gaps: Parsing library choice, LLM config approach, insertion UX pattern

evidence.note: Implements: extension startup, command registration framework. Serves: Stay Grounded in Code (extension always ready). Depends on: package.json activation events. Gap: which commands to register?

what: Entry point: activate/deactivate extension, register commands
key_basis: VSCode extension minimum requirements
key_gaps: Command registration strategy, activate/deactivate lifecycle

evidence.note: Implements: activation event (onStartupFinished), command definitions, extension metadata. Serves: extension startup and discoverability. Depends on: extension.ts commands. Gap: which activation event? lazy vs always-on?

what: VSCode extension contract: metadata, activation, commands, contributions
key_basis: VSCode extension manifest requirements
key_gaps: Activation strategy, command palette visibility

evidence.note: Implements: TypeScript â†’ JavaScript transpilation for VSCode runtime. Serves: all TS code compiles correctly. Depends on: extension.ts, future src/ code. Gap: which target version? ES2020+?

key_basis: VSCode extension build requirements
key_gaps: TypeScript target version, sourcemaps strategy

evidence.note: Implements: F5 debugging setup, debug host, breakpoints. Serves: local development and testing. Depends on: extension.ts, tsconfig.json. Gap: which debug approach?

evidence.note: Layer to talk to LLM (Claude, local, configurable) with @rhizome persona context. MCP stub to forward commands. Allows: property inference, code review via personas, decision logging. Serves: Understand Before Commit, Test-Driven Top-Down.

what: LLM communication with rhizome-aware comments and MCP stub
key_basis: User request for rhizome-enabled LLM integration
key_gaps: MCP protocol approach, persona context passing, LLM config

evidence.note: Abstraction over LLM provider. Enables: API key config, model selection, fallback behavior. Depends on: config/extensionConfig. Serves: Understand Before Commit, property inference, LLM infer mode.

what: LLM client: abstract interface for talking to Claude/local/other
key_basis: LLM integration architecture
key_gaps: Which LLM backends? Fallback strategy?

evidence.note: Builds context from: active persona, decision phase, current code context. Passes to LLM so responses are persona-aware. Serves: all user stories (decisions grounded in personas). Depends on: llmClient, .rhizome personas.

what: Rhizome context builder: attach persona/role/phase to LLM prompts
key_basis: Rhizome-aware LLM interaction
key_gaps: Which persona context? How to serialize/deserialize?

evidence.note: MCP (Model Context Protocol) server stub. Listens for @rhizome prompts in comments. Forwards to: external Claude session, rhizome CLI, decision logging. Serves: Understand Before Commit (async LLM help), Stay Grounded (keep decisions in-editor). Depends on: llmClient, rhizomeContext.

what: MCP stub: forward @rhizome commands to external tools/Claude
key_basis: User request for MCP forwarding
key_gaps: MCP protocol implementation, command format

evidence.note: Design: RhizomeBackend interface with multiple implementations (CLIBackend, MCPBackend). Extension depends on interface, not concrete impl. Strategy: start with CLI (already installed), swap to MCP later for user distribution without refactoring extension.

what: Backend abstraction: swap CLI/MCP without changing extension code
key_basis: User workflow question: bootstrap vs future adoption
key_gaps: Which methods on interface? Error handling strategy?

evidence.note: Implements RhizomeBackend interface. Spawns rhizome process, parses output (JSON), handles errors. Fast path for bootstrap. Depends on: rhizome in PATH. User Story: bootstrap with existing tools.

what: CLIBackend: call rhizome CLI directly via child_process
key_basis: Bootstrap strategy - use what's already available
key_gaps: Error handling, output parsing, timeout strategy?

evidence.note: Implements RhizomeBackend interface. Calls MCP server (localhost:port), handles JSON-RPC protocol. Future path for user distribution. Depends on: MCP server running. User Story: scale to users, no Python dependency.

what: MCPBackend: call rhizome via MCP microservice on localhost
key_basis: Future adoption path - ease distribution to non-devs
key_gaps: MCP protocol impl, port management, lifecycle?

evidence.note: Abstract interface. Methods: record(), personaList(), personaShow(), personaAdopt(), etc. Extension depends on this interface, not concrete impl. Enables swap between CLIBackend and MCPBackend.

what: RhizomeBackend interface: abstraction over CLI and MCP implementations
key_basis: Abstraction layer design pattern
key_gaps: Complete method list? Response types?

evidence.note: HTML comments in QUICKSTART.md and syllabus.md guide course creators through thinking (not just doing). Questions appear in VSCode, invisible to students. Forces clarity on: outcomes, assessments, accessibility, AI use. Branch: don-socratic-questions

what: Inline Socratic comments threaded through 1cc course template

evidence.note: Module 1-4: each assignment now has don-socratic comments questioning design choices, pedagogical reasoning, accessibility, psychological safety. Questions appear in VSCode markdown files, invisible to students. Commit: all assignments updated with TODOs and challenges. Branch: don-socratic-questions

what: Inline Socratic questions embedded in all 4 module assignments
key_basis: Instructor request: add don treatment to assignment prompts in situ
key_gaps: Should syllabus templates and rubrics get same treatment?

evidence.note: Core feature: users select code, right-click 'Ask don-socratic', receive Socratic questioning. Command registered first (before stub). Discoverable via context menu. Don is always listening, ready to guide reflection. Updates: package.json keywords/description, extension.ts command structure, context menu integration.

Design questions: local context? which personas? new CLI command or extend existing? Error handling for LLM failures. This informs extension.ts message-passing design.

evidence.note: Webview needs to send question to extension, handle loading states while extension calls CLI backend, receive and display persona response.
